front.head: To the Author of the Farmer's Letters, which were written in IRELAND in the Year of the Rebellion, by HENRY BROOKE, Esq; 1745.

lg.l: OH thou, whose artless, free-born genius charms,
Whose rustick zeal each patriot bosom warms;
Pursue the glorious task, the pleasing toil,
Forsake the fields and a nobler soil;
Extend the care to human kind,
And of virtue in our youth:
